devNote: Technically it is acid if entering from node 1 and the statue hasn't been cleared, but that doesn't seem worth modeling.
The acid is not there regardless when entering from node 2.

nodes.name: Acid Chozo Statue
nodes.note: This node represents the ledge the statue is on. This is why it can be reached without breaking the PB blocks, but not unlocked.

nodes.name: Junction Above Acid Plug, Without Acid
nodes.note: Because going here while there is acid is pointless unless traveling from 1 to 3, this node will be considered to only be visitable when the acid is gone

nodes.name: Bottom Junction Right of Morph Tunnel

to.devNote: 4 requires that the acid is gone.

strats.name: SpringFling over the acid
note: Begin with SpeedBooster unequipped, and run&jump over the acid into an airball.
Once Samus begins falling, equip SpringBall and SpeedBooster to safely land on the other side near the statue.

strats.name: Gravityless Acid Dive
note: Try to jump to the far left side raised ledges to reduce the time spent in acid.
This could mean turning off HiJump, or airballing to jump farther.

strats.name: Wall Pocket Acid Dive
note: There is a hole in the left side wall that Samus can fit into by shrinking her hitbox.
Once in the wall, stand up if crouched then turnaround into a buffered spinjump to jump out of the acid.
strats.devNote: Not notable because it only skips a walljump.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport Crystal Flash (from Red Brinstar Firefleas)
note: Grapple teleporting here will spawn Samus inside the wall behind the Acid Chozo statue.
To escape, perform a Crystal Flash to stand up, then morph and roll out to the right.
Samus will be visible but off-camera, making the movement tricky.
While off camera, the Chozo hand will not function (i.e., will not trigger the acid lowering cutscene).

strats.name: Grapple Teleport Power Bomb (from Moat)
note: After teleporting, press down to retract Grapple.
Samus will be inside the Power Bomb blocks behind the Acid Chozo statue hand.
Use a Power Bomb, wait to begin falling, then hold right to roll out under the hand.
Samus will be visible but off-camera, making the movement tricky.
Holding right too early after laying the Power Bomb will cause Samus to get stuck inside the Chozo hand;
in this case, Samus can get out by unmorphing, remorphing, and rolling to the right on top of the hand.
While off camera, the Chozo hand will not function (i.e., will not trigger the acid lowering cutscene).

strats.name: Grapple Teleport Crystal Flash (from Red Brinstar Firefleas)
note: Grapple teleporting here will spawn Samus inside the wall behind the Acid Chozo statue.
To escape, perform a Crystal Flash to stand up, then morph and roll out to the right.
Samus will be visible but off-camera, making the movement tricky.
While off camera, the Chozo hand will not function (i.e., will not trigger the acid lowering cutscene).

strats.name: Grapple Teleport Power Bomb (from Moat)
note: After teleporting, press down to retract Grapple.
Samus will be inside the Power Bomb blocks behind the Acid Chozo statue hand.
Use a Power Bomb, wait to begin falling, then hold right to roll out under the hand.
Samus will be visible but off-camera, making the movement tricky.
Holding right too early after laying the Power Bomb will cause Samus to get stuck inside the Chozo hand;
in this case, Samus can get out by unmorphing, remorphing, and rolling to the right on top of the hand.
While off camera, the Chozo hand will not function (i.e., will not trigger the acid lowering cutscene).

strats.name: Avoid Damage
strats.note: Wait for the first Holtz to attack then either use the Magdollite for IFrames, or avoid the projectiles and continue dodging bats.

strats.name: Tank the Damage
strats.note: Wait for the first Holtz before trying to cross.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: 4 requires that the acid is gone.

strats.name: Avoid Damage
strats.note: Wait for the Magdollite to attack then either use it for IFrames, or jump over the swooping Holtzes.

strats.name: CF Grapple Clip
strats.note: Menu to Grappling Beam before the crystal flash ends and mash shoot while holding down.
strats.devNote: The extra Power Bomb or bombs is to get through the bomb blocks.

nodes.name: Golden Torizo Arena Junction (Fight Not Started)

to.devNote: This link indicates passing below GT before the fight has time to begin.

devNote: These links can collect the Super Item Location without starting the GT encounter.
There are more precise strats, but it is more reasonable to active GT before attempting them.

strats.name: GT Crumble Jump to Left Item
strats.note: Jump on the crumble blocks before they break to reach the item, at the risk on falling through.

strats.name: GT Bomb Boost to Left Item
strats.note: Uses a single bomb blast to just barely get propelled over the crumble pit.

strats.name: Shinespark (Bottom)
devNote: Sparking in from the bottom position requires fewer heat frames, as you bonk the side of the item pedestal.
FIXME: The heat frames for the crash animation occur after the item collection, which could matter if the item is an ETank.
Likewise, one shinespark frame of damage occurs after the item collection (assuming not stopping early).

strats.name: Shinespark (Top)
devNote: Sparking in from the top position requires more heat frames, because you end up on top of the item pedestal and need to move off of it.
FIXME: The heat frames for the crash animation (and for moving off the pedestal) occur after the item collection, which could matter if the item is an ETank.
Likewise, 3 shinespark frames of damage occur after the item collection (assuming not stopping early).

strats.name: Running Jump (Short Runway)
strats.note: Using momentum from the previous room, run and jump over the crumble blocks to reach the item.

strats.name: Running Jump (Longer Runway)
strats.note: Using momentum from the previous room, run and jump over the crumble blocks to reach the item.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.
Samus will not be visible during the climb.
If Golden Torizo is alive, the fight will be triggered but does not create any risk of damage.

strats.name: Leave With Runway (GT Alive)
strats.note: Wait to run under Golden Torizo as it jumps.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
note: If entering from the right door with Golden Torizo not yet defeated, come in already morphed, Crystal Flash immediately, then morph and roll under Golden Torizo.

strats.name: GT Crumble Jump from Left Item
strats.note: It takes a short hop to avoid hitting the ceiling to do this with only one crumble jump.

strats.name: GT Bomb Boost from Left Item
strats.note: Use a single bomb blast to just barely get propelled over the crumble pit.

strats.name: Speed HiJump Screw
strats.note: Build run speed for a jump straight into the destructible blocks.

strats.name: GT Supers Screw Walljump
strats.note: This is kind of tricky because Screw off a walljump can only break bomb blocks if you change directions before bonking.

strats.name: GT Supers Walljump Into Double Shinespark
note: One vertical spark is needed to open up the area directly above.
Then, a second horizontal spark is performed where those blocks were cleared.
Try to aim for the seam between tiles to break more blocks.  And the left side of the opening may be slightly easier.

strats.name: GT Supers Double Shinespark With HiJump
note: One vertical spark is needed to open up the area directly above.
A running jump is used to jump high enough into the revealed hole for a horizontal spark.

strats.name: GT Supers IBJ
strats.note: Expects two IBJs; one to break a block, then another one to get back up.
strats.devNote: Needs strats for variations of IBJs, mainly for heatframe count.

strats.name: Instant Morph Bomb Placement.
note: Walljump up to reach the left ledge below the bomb blocks then perform an instant morph to place a bomb.
Walljump up a second time and again instant morph off that left ledge to enter the 1 tile hole created by the bomb.

strats.name: Springwall with Bombs
note: Uses a Springwall to put a bomb on the left corner bomb block, then a second one to get in there.
Then clears the rest of the bomb blocks normally.
It winds up costing less heat frames than IBJ, if you fall.

strats.name: SpaceJump
strats.note: Avoid touching the ground below GT.  Try not to touch GT without ScrewAttack active.

strats.name: HiJump and Speed
strats.note: Jump a before reaching the rightmost floor pillar.

strats.name: Walljump
note: Jump over the space below GT that is between the door and first foreground pillar and walljump up.
Break the bomb blocks with a power bomb to make space.  Then use Screw Attack to pass through the inactive GT.

strats.name: Springball Jump
strats.note: Springball jump into GT to bounce to the upper level.
strats.devNote: Strats can follow 6->5->4 if GT is defeated.

nodes.name: Middle Right Door Spawn At Junction

to.note: Shinespark and XRayClimb have a direct link. Other strats should go 1 -> 4 -> 2.
Shinespark and XRayClimb have a direct link. Other strats should go 1 -> 4 -> 2 -> 3.
The heat frames for these strats assumes you've already fallen from the door, because the cost is already baked into the subsequent 5-> 3 heat costs when relevant.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Left-Side X-Ray Climb (to Top Door)
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.
strats.devNote: Heat frames split into the actual climb and the setup in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Left-Side X-Ray Climb (to Middle Door)
strats.note: Climb up half a screen.

strats.name: Carry G-Mode Morph Back Through
strats.devNote: Artificial morph will allow Samus not to fall; real Morph is not sufficient.

strats.name: Doorway Speedjump
strats.note: Position yourself in the door way, then run and jump. Makes it possible to walljump up.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Doorway CWJ
strats.note: Position Samus in the doorway a few pixels from the edge. Dashing stationary spinjump into a delayed CWJ and hopefully catch the upper ledge with a walljump.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Transition Screwjump
strats.note: Run through the doorway with enough momentum to break the bomb blocks with Screw.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Transition Screwjump (Tricky Dash Jump)
strats.note: Run through the doorway with enough momentum to break the bomb blocks with Screw.

strats.name: Jump into Room Shinespark
note: Jump into Screw Attack Room and spark diagonally once above the center of the door vertically.
Or diagonally spark anywhere that is not the bottom of the door in the previous room.
strats.devNote: TODO: Sparking diagonally through the door cannot be shown as an alternative.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.
strats.devNote: Heat frames split into the actual climb and the setup in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Grapple Teleport Inside Wall
note: After teleporting, Samus should be standing inside the wall.
Retract Grapple by pressing up, which will pull Samus down and right.
Hold right, and release Grapple while still holding right.
Perform a turn-around spin jump (to the left).
Then morph and roll out to the right.

strats.name: Temporary Blue
strats.note: This expects the more controlled Temporary Blue to fall though the blocks, not storing a shinecharge through the door.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Temporary Blue Descent and Shinespark Escape Middle Door Part 1
strats.note: Store the shinecharge while hitting the door transition to maintain the ability to break blocks.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Screw Descent and Shinespark Escape Middle Door Part 1
strats.note: Enter with a shinespark stored and screw attack down to the item.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Transition Speedjump with Bombs
strats.note: Run in the adjacent room and jump through the door, to place a Bomb to break the top bomb blocks.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Transition Speedjump with Bombs (Tricky Dash Jump)
strats.note: Run in the adjacent room and jump through the door, to place a Bomb to break the top bomb blocks.

strats.name: Temporary Blue (Full Runway)
strats.note: This expects the more controlled Temporary Blue to fall though the blocks, not storing a shinecharge on the first breakable block.

strats.name: Temporary Blue (Short Runway)
strats.note: This expects the more controlled Temporary Blue to fall though the blocks, not storing a shinecharge on the first breakable block.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Temporary Blue Descent and Shinespark Escape Top Door Part 1
strats.note: Simultaneously store a shinespark and break through the bomb blocks down to the Screw Attack item location.
strats.devNote: canShinechargeMovementTricky is to represent the difficulty of activating the shinecharge in a precise place near the edge.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Screw Descent and Shinespark Escape Top Door Part 1
strats.note: Store a shinespark then use screw to break through the bomb blocks down to the Screw Attack item location.
strats.devNote: Storing the spark on the left side of the runway takes fine control over shinecharge spacing, but that is ok at this difficulty.

strats.name: Stored Moonfall Clip
note: Moonfall to clip through the Bomb blocks to the bottom of the room.

strats.name: Come in Getting Blue Speed
strats.devNote: FIXME: Running in is not required. Entering the room with canBlueSpaceJump could work, for example.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport Extension Clip
note: After teleporting, as Samus swings to the right, begin holding down to extend Grapple just as Samus is slightly right of vertical.
Samus should swing back left and get stuck on the floor one tile to the right of the Grapple attachment point.
Release Grapple and Samus will clip through the floor.

strats.name: Stored Moonfall Clip
note: Moonfall to clip through the Bomb blocks
Break spin with Shot or Angle Aim to avoid clipping all the way to the bottom of the room.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Shinespark Escape Mid Door Part 2
strats.note: Diagonally shinespark towards the middle door.
devNote: Obstacle C is indicating that Samus has a shinecharge ready to be used.
Useful only if you cannot reach the door at 2.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room Shinespark Escape Top Door Part 2
strats.note: Carry a shinecharge down though the bomb blocks and shinespark back up.
strats.devNote: Obstacle C is indicating that Samus has a shinecharge ready to be used.

strats.name: Screw Attack Room IBJ
devNote: FIXME: This is a longer IBJ if B is broken with a power bomb (All the blocks are broken).

strats.name: Screw Attack Room IBJ to Break the Top Blocks
strats.note: Place a Power Bomb during the IBJ to break the blocks without falling.

strats.name: Power Bombs
devNote: FIXME: This doesn't quite break the blocks above, but going up after has more requirements.
The canTrivialMidAirMorph could be avoided by using Spring Ball on entry or from the doorsill.

strats.name: IBJ to Break the Top Blocks
strats.note: Expects that Samus falls down afterwards.
strats.devNote: FIXME: This assumes B is not broken, add other IBJ variants.

strats.name: Springwall with Bombs
strats.note: Use a Springwall to get up to the bomb blocks, to break them with a bomb.

strats.name: Leave With Runway
strats.devNote: This assumes we must wait for the Rippers to pass (or freeze or kill them).

strats.name: Kill some Rippers
strats.note: The time lost by setting up a few strategic kills is pretty much offset by not having damage recoil.

strats.name: Kill some Rippers
strats.note: It's more chaotic because the GGG's unreliability makes the room more variable, but one PB or 2 Super kills should usually do it.
